reviewText: The reproductions are awesome, clear and thick high quality DVDs.  The reason why I took off one star is because they are 4 stacked DVDs in a box which makes it very easy to scratch.  I would have added an extra star if they would have spent the extra 50 cents for 3 more DVD cases.
I love old movies and to be able to get four wonderful movies all together made my day! I had these movies within a week of ordering them. I'm very pleased with the quick service I received.

Have been looking for this version of "Little Women" and was very happy to find it included in with such other fine movies.  Only "Little Women" was in color.  I had no problem enjoying the others in black and white.  Great, great classic stories.  I loved them all and will enjoy watching them again.

Great set of wonderful films.  And each movie is on it's own disk, NO double sided DVDs.  I bought this set in order to get Little Women, which is the very very best version you will ever see.  It's a beautiful film that fills your heart with that good old emotion that only the older movies could do.  The 1933 version was good, but this version of Little Women is superb, and the casting is beyond excellent.  Buy this set for this movie alone!  (And avoid the HORRIBLE remake with Winona Ryder, which is a total waste of time and doesn't even follow the story line of the book.)

I'm not going to review these movies so much as to tell you that buying them is a smart thing to do. Turner Classic Movies has restored these movies and they look great. All the movies they have put on DVD are excellent and worth a couple hours of entertainment. Fans of classic movies are going to want to get them all. Four classic movies for under twelve dollars are a steal. This is barely more than what it costs for one person to go to the theater. If you enjoyed this set be sure to see TCM Greatest Classic Films Collection: Murder Mysteries (The Maltese Falcon / The Big Sleep / Dial M for Murder / The Postman Always Rings Twice 1946),TCM Greatest Classic Film Collection: Astaire & Rogers (The Gay Divorcee / Top Hat / Swing Time / Shall We Dance),TCM Greatest Classic Films Collection: Holiday (Christmas in Connecticut / A Christmas Carol 1938 / The Shop Around the Corner / It Happened on 5th Avenue),TCM Greatest Classic Films Collection: Broadway Musicals (Show Boat / Annie Get Your Gun / Kiss Me Kate / Seven Brides for Seven Brothers),Tcm Greatest Classic Films: Thin Man 1,TCM Greatest Classic Films Collection: Romantic Comedies (Adam's Rib / Woman of the Year / The Philadelphia Story / Bringing Up Baby),TCM Greatest Classic Films Collection: Hitchcock Thrillers (Suspicion / Strangers on a Train / The Wrong Man / I Confess), to list a few. CA Luster

THE ORIGINAL PRIDE AND PREJUDICE IS AMAZING AND YOU WILL ENJOY EVERY MINUTE OF THE MOVIE W/MR. DARCY AND LIZZY!!!! THE BEST MOVIE EVER!!! THE OTHER MOVIES ARE WONDERFUL AS WELL...I MEAN MADAME BOVARY, ANNA KARENINA, AND LITTLE WOMEN ARE JUST ADDED BONUSES!!!!! :)
Four fantastic films in ONE COLLECTION!! Great movies! A definite must for fans of these movies!  My favorite, PRIDE AND PREDJUDICE!!

Little Women

When I was growing up in the St. Michael's Orphan Asylum and Industrial School in Hopewell, N.J. a Catholic nun would read to us at bedtime from the pages of a novel.  My last waking minutes were filled with descriptions of warm hearths and home baked goods and although we had no parents of our own, we could experience vestiges of family life at least vicariously.  The book the nun read from was Louisa May Alcott's Little Women.  As boys, our attentions soon turned to spiders, comic books, baseball, and one day someone switched Little Women for The Jackie Robinson Story.  When I grew up and had a family of my own, subconsciously at least, I think I tried to duplicate for my children the atmosphere of family life I'd heard about in the pages of Little Women.

Oscar winning set designers Cedric Gibbons and Paul Grosse collaborate on the movie set production and begin this color film version with a motif of a beautifully designed Whitman Sampler that fades to a Currier & Ives winter scene. It seems Elizabeth Taylor puts a great deal of herself into her character role "Amy" when she says "a princess always knows she's a princess".  Janet Leigh (Psycho) is older sister Meg and June Allyson, married to film noir star Dick Powell in real life, is tomboy sister Josephine. Mary Obrien (Meet Me In St. Louis) as Beth rounds out the quartet of sisters trying to find their destinies as the Civil War unwinds around them.  Josephine is moody and ambitious, moving to New York to advance a writing career, although her fictional characters are hollow and filled with exaggerated melodrama rather than truth.  It takes a family tragedy to boil away the superficial and get down to what is real.

The film print is rich with warm tones and colors in this restoration.  Mary Astor (The Maltese Falcon) is appropriately supportive as Marmee March and Lucile Watson is blustery and wind swept in her mammoth costumes as curmudgeonly Auntie March with a heart of gold.

Madame Bovary

Madame Bovary c'est moi (Madame Bovary is me) Gustav Flaubert said famously.  A French court took him at his word and put the novelist on trial for defaming the people of France, and he defended himself successfully.  James Mason is Flaubert and uses his overarching voice convincingly in the film and the French court is appropriately riveted when he sums up.

Lana Turner was initially scheduled to play Emma Bovary, although studio heads thought Jennifer Jones had a more neurotic acting style compared to Lana Turner's eroticism, and Jones' performance in the leading role confirmed their instincts.

Vincent Minnelli's set and direction are impeccable; he gives full flight to Emma's outsized aspirations for fame and renown.  He also gives prominent weight to the money changers who are keeping score as Emma racks up bills no one can pay, least of all her husband Charles, played by Van Hefflin, who made a film career out of being reasonable.  His mundane and grounded character contrasts brilliantly with his wife's mercurial temperament.  The black and white print in this restoration is completely free of dirt, debris and other imperfections.  Each film in this set has its own disc and cover artwork, in contrast to other TCM productions where films have been ganged two to a disc.

Anna Karenina

Screen legend Greta Garbo had been agitating for a remake of her 1927 silent film Love, a derivative of Anna Karenina.  In 1935 she got her wish - and we know the old saying: be careful what you wish for.  In real life, co-star Frederich March had a reputation as an amorous adventurer; legend has it that to ward off his advances, Gretta Garbo walked around the set of Anna Karenina with garlic in her mouth between takes.  This is my first Gretta Garbo film and even though it's embarrassing to admit such a thing, I'm glad to own it.

The great Vivien Leigh (Gone With The Wind) also wanted the part of Anna for this film and when she didn't get it, her and husband Lawrence Olivier went off to England and shot a competing version to the Anna Karenina presented here.

Casting is somewhat of an issue in this film.  Frederick Bartholomew, who plays Anna's husband, is handsome, cultivated and much taller compared to March's short stature, and some viewers may to wonder why Anna wants to run off with someone less handsome than her husband.  In the English version, Anna's husband is short, corpulent, almost deformed.  Then too, Gretta Garbo is almost always  composed, not revealing much in the way of  inner turmoil, while Vivien Leigh seems to frazzle and disintegrate right before our eyes.

Director Clarence Brown was a specialist in working with Gretta Garbo (they made 7 pictures together), once again, Cedric Gibbons did the production design.  The quality of the film print is excellent throughout.

Pride and Prejudice

It's said that F. Scott Fitzgerald based his unfinished masterpiece, The Last Tycoon on MGM's Irving Thalberg, who died suddenly in 1936, but not before acquiring the rights to film Pride and Prejudice, the novel by Jane Austen that examines a cross section of English country life.  Thalberg's wife, Norma Shearer, had been penciled in for the female lead, but the part went instead to Greer Garson, Louis B. Mayer's up and coming star, giving rise to the belief that the best path to success is: stay healthy.

Greer Garson (Mrs. Miniver) as Lizzy is classically imperturbable leading a gaggle of five sisters chasing village newcomers who are young, single and (the tiebreaker) rich.  It's hugely comic watching the sisters assess the newcomers as they perform the appropriate financial calculations of net worth in their heads.  No wonder the dialog is bright, snappy, and to the point - the great British writer Aldous Huxley (Brave New World) shares a screenwriting credit with Jane Murfin.

Cedric Gibbons and Paul Grosse won a Production Design Oscar for this film.  The costumes are suitably sumptuous for an English period piece and the film quality is excellent in this restoration.

This will probably be a strong seller in TCM's "Greatest Classic Films" series, a programme designed to bring some of the best MGM/Warner-controlled films to the masses in budget-friendly sets. Unlike the previous TCM sets, this collection has each film presented on it's own disc, as opposed to four films sharing two double-sided discs. MGM's 1940 production of PRIDE AND PREJUDICE is one of my favourite screen versions of the Jane Austen classic. Greer Garson stars as Elizabeth Bennet, and Laurence Olivier (fresh from his "Wuthering Heights" success) is a fine Darcy. MGM costumier Adrian threw the original Regency period setting of the book out of the window - the result being that Garson and the ladies almost suffocate under costumes made of endless frilly laces and satins. Classic MGM...never let a story's period setting get in the way of a good costume! Special Features - Oscar-nominated Crime Doesn't Pay short "Eyes of the Navy", and classic cartoon "The Fishing Bear". MGM's 1949 colour remake of LITTLE WOMEN sparkles with June Allyson (perfectly-cast as Jo), along with Mary Astor as Marmee, Margaret O'Brien as Beth, Janet Leigh as Meg, Peter Lawford as Laurie; and a blonde-wigged Elizabeth Taylor as Amy. Though it falls decidedly short next to the well-regarded 1933 RKO version with Katharine Hepburn, MGM's 1949 remake oddly copies many of the original set and costume cues from the earlier film. Special Features - "Lux Radio Theater" broadcast with the original stars (audio), and "Successful Women-Successful Films" essay. Jennifer Jones is positively haunting, as Gustave Flaubert's MADAME BOVARY. This 1949 Vincente Minnelli-directed masterpiece, filmed in crisp black-and-white, may very well just be Jones' greatest screen performance. As the simple country doctor's wife who yearns to experience a life of glamour, wealth and romance, Jennifer Jones madly spins into her doom in the movie's signature ballroom sequence. A sheer masterpiece. With Louis Jourdan, Van Heflin and James Mason. Special Features - Pete Smith Specialty short "Those Good Old Days", classic cartoon "Out-Foxed"; and the trailer. Greta Garbo had already filmed Tolstoy's tragic story of "Anna Karenina" (as "Love") during her silent days, but the 1935 MGM remake of ANNA KARENINA stands as one of her finest performances. Matched by a fervent Fredric March as Vronsky, Garbo's Anna is as mysterious and otherwordly as the fog from which she emerges at the beginning of the story. The original stand-alone DVDs of Little Women and Anna Karenina (1935) are now out-of-print (with Madame Bovary (1949) looking like it's going to be discontinued soon too); so this set will be good for those who missed out last time.

I love old movies! These classics are a great addition to my TCM library. Having said that...the way the DVDs were stacked in the case is horrible! Don't plan on storing them in the DVD case because they will get scratched. My rating and review is for the actual movies only. If I had to rate the packaging I would give 1 star, but that's a failure on the studio distributers part.

I bought this dvd for the "little women" with June Allison. What a great movie! But I did not expect the other movies to be ad good. Boy was I surprized!  These movies are great and even my granddaughters enjoyed them with me.

Great value for the price - four classic films. I was looking for three of them so the fourth was an added bonus. The films are not cheap copies of copies you can sometimes get when purchasing a set at a store.
Great movies.

This is well produced and collected set of classic movies. The picture quality is super
I love it

Got this one for my wife and she loved it!  Great bunch of the original "chic flicks".  Well made movies with great actors and actresses (I know you're not supposed to use that word anymore, but I'm old and not about to change).  I got a great attaboy for this gift!

Mom loves it. Sooo glad.  We saw one of them on tv and I thought I would love to see that with her again so I looked for the movie and only found it as part of the TCM set.  But then I thought hmm. Wonder if its on amazon.  Sure enough. And at 1/3rd the price! Go amazon! (Sorry TCM website :P)

Am slow in repaint etc.. of my home as I am disabled but will play it when done. This was a wonderful collection of movies and I was glad to purchase them together. Saved money that way.  We are blessed to be able to shop here for these great deals.

I am keeping it as a treasure of memories, will not open and therefore cannot comment. As I recall, Madame Bovary was off limits for me as a youngster, but the others were fabulous, for the day,era,decade.
Truly four of many masterpieces and I liked each and everyone of them.  These films has brought me literally to tears and that's because they pulled on my heart cords.

I love Pride and Prejudice and have looked for it everywhere and did not want to pay top dollar. I got 4 movies for the price of one and they arrived together, brand new, excellent quality. I would only recommend "Pride and Prejudice' and 'Little Women' as the other two movies were immoral.
I am so very glad I bought this, so many wonderful movies to watch. A very happy and enjoyful time, I dearly love these old movies!
They loved the movie. And they hadn't seen two of the movies before.  So APlus they will now be ordering movies from you in the future.
These are some of the movies that put the 'class' in classic!! Movies that shaped a nation & made people believe they could be more than we are!
All is great. The movies are wonderful!!!! We love, especially, Pride and Prejudice, and Little Women. Great movies, the other 2 are not our favorites.

The movies are good, picture and sound are perfect.
It is wonderful to be able to enjoy the good actors of yesterday.
Very healthy and romantic without the bad attitude of today.

My first pick is Pride and Prejudice- With Greer Garson-L/Oliv-I love it.  She makes a lovely Elizabeth-Little Women-June Allison-Eliz-Taylor and Janet Lee.  Love all the characters-very sweet movie-Madame Bovary-Jennifer Jones-L/Jordan-this is a very sad movie but is well played by Jennifer Jones.  Anna Karenia-Greta Garbo-you need say no more she is great.  The quality of the movies are good-I have so far never had a problem with Amazon.  Movies arrived on time.
Great quality video for a reasonable price. It's great to get four classic movies on one disk by TCM. Thanks.

WOW! Four wonderful movies for the price of one.  I basically wanted it for Little Women and found myself enjoying the other three as well.  The seller was great in shipping it out and having it arrive ahead of the scheduled date.
Four terrific movies with actual "Movie Stars".....  Very pleased with this purchase and I would highly recommend to old movie buffs.

I will be honest, I mostly bought this set because of  the adaptations of Little Women, and Pride and Prejudice.  This set includes 2 more films, Madam Bovary and Anna Karenina.  I have not seen either one of those films, but I thought I would buy the whole set because I like old films, and thought why not?  The set is great.  The discs are not cheap copies, but are most likely the first disc from collector's editions.  They are really well restored.  The only thing I wish they would do differently is how the package the disks.  They are just stacked one on top of the other.  Which could lead to them getting scratched over time.  I have another set from TCM that is not like this, they have their own individual "flap." It is a little annoying when trying to take out a dvd, but at least there isn't a movie on both sides of the disc.

All in all I am happy with my purchase and will most likely order more TCM sets like this.  They are great for space-saving, and  for rainy days when you have nothing else to do but curl up and watch an old movie while the rain pelts on your window.
My daughter loves the classics, and is only 16, this was a wonderful addition to her "classic movie collection!" It's perfect for her to take when we are traveling in the car too!

Pride and Prejudice is a classic film that is acted beautifully by Greer. It is my all-time favorite movie and cannot be compared to the contemporary versions. The sheer spice the the characters Elizabeth and Darcy is worth a sit down. Watch with your teen daughters.
I'm delighted with the dvd Little Women, having tried for some time to get this version, this being the main reason I purchased this set. The others are okay and it was interesting watching them.
greer garson Jennifer jones garbo, june Allyson what a group of leading ladies! they play from being nice to not so nice. I like this collection very much.
A great collection of classic films which will take you back to a time when acting was simpler and films less garbled by special effects. A good grouping.
We haven't gotten to watch this yet, but we look forward to it.  We made this purchase for Little Women, but we're sure we'll love the others also.
I was disappointed that only 'Little Women' was the only The CD case all are shown in color. That and other movies arrived on time with no damage.

I was a bit leery of ordering this set of movies being afraid that the quality would be poor.  So, far I've looked at Little Women, Madame Bovary and Pride and Prejudice and the quality of each one is excellent.  I would not hesitate to order more sets of TCM movies. Of course I've seen Little Women many times. This is by far the best film ever done of it. Each character is beautifully cast and they all perform wonderfully.  It's been a long time since I read Madame Bovary and this is the first time I've seen the film.  All I can say is that nobody does MANIC better than Jennifer Jones.  She either had not reached her most manic stage or she was able to tone it down in this film. It is actually a very subtle performance of a woman who was never really sane. The film is very well done with excellent cast, filming and directing. I always enjoy old B&W melodrama and this is perfect. This is not my favorite version of Pride and Prejudice since the costuming is ludicrous, ridiculous and any other derogatory word you can think of.  However, to give her her due, nobody floats around a room in a huge crinoline skirt better than Greer Garson.  The film sticks fairly close to the story and the acting is excellent. Plus, the B&W filming is wonderful. They apparently spent a lot of time and money on this film.  I must say, however, that I was terribly disappointed in Anna Karenina. Not because of the quality of the DVD as it is excellent but because it is one of the most boring movies I've ever seen in my life.  I don't think I've ever seen Greta Garbo in a movie before and now I know that I haven't missed a thing. She is just a boring actress. Never changes expression, boring voice, in no way convincing in the love scenes.  Frederic March is simply miscast. He doesn't convey at all the fascinating man that Vronsky was and never conveys the true passion that he is supposed to be feeling. It all looks like play acting which of course it is but it's not supposed to appear that way.

I got this collection because I like Pride & Prejudice but I ended up Loving all the movies
although Madame Bovary Is a bit of a downer. I would still get this collection if only for Little women and Pride and Prejudice very satisfied with this collection and great price too!
I purchased this collection when my daughter asked for "Anna Karenina" because it was highly rated and she loved it!  I can't wait to get my hands on it!
Great movie, really good quality of the video. I got in time and the packaging is nice. Really good buy except that the movies are stacked together instead of in it's own dvd section.
Four fabulous vintage films at a great price. You just can't beat the value on the TCM four film collections!!

Very good. And what's even great - all 4 of the movies were close captioned for the deaf. So my family got to enjoy it too.
Yes, I would recommend this dvd indeed.
A definite plus for those who love classic films.  Although Pride & Prejudice is much altered from the book, it is entertaining to watch.  I could watch this series over and over!

I can't wait for my favorite movies to come on tv and then most of the time I'm at work when they come on :(.  With this dvd I can watch some of my favorites anytime I like.  Pride and Prejudice, and Little Women are well known and beloved classics.  I was so happy to find Madame Bovary and Anna Karenina, too, because somehow I'd never seen them before.  So now I have two more favorites!  This is a really good collection of four classics you are going to really enjoy.  Get the popcorn ready.
Great item for a great price.  Some of these movies are hard to find, so I was happy for find this grouping.  Shipped very quickly.
Gave this a 4 star rating only because one of the movies is not really a favorite. But I love the other three. Wonderful value.

Excellent for anyone who appreciates great actors of the past in the classics of literature. I bought it for Sir Laurence Olivier's Mr. Darcy and have always liked this version of Little Women, I enjoyed the Madame Bovary w/ Jennifer Jones, a good version of Anna Karenina, even if of the 4 it's a story I never cared for, it is still a delight to look at for the costumes and sets,

I don't understand why they thought putting depressing messes like Anna Karenina and Madame Bovary with heart warming inspirations like Pride and Prejudice, and Little Women would be a good idea. Just because they are about women?! Inexplicable. But, for the price you can't really complain.

A friend of mine who is a shut-in has a son who helps her and he'd read Anna Karenina, but hadn't seen the movie so instead of just giving them the one movie, I was able to give them four!  He'd read some of the other books that the movie was based on, so it was a great gift for very little money.
Never thought I would find this edition of Little Women to add to my collection of the other versions of movies made, but it is great.
These movies area some of my favorite! This "Pride and Prejudice" is the best...Greer Garson is one off my favorite actresses. This version of "Little Women" is also my favorite. Great movies!
Love the old classics and the actors from those times.  A must have dvd and what a bargain with 4 movies on one dvd.

We primarily bought this for our granddaughters all under 9 years old. We believe that this classics are the perfect proper stories for girls even today. Let them enjoy The Hunger Games, but let them also learn what responsibility, pride, laughter, and love means as well.

I loved the June Allyson version of Little Women, and then saw Greer Garson in Pride and Prejudice, so when I saw the two movies together in one offering I jumped at the chance to get both films.  I watched Garbo in ANNA KARENINA with Fredrick March and it was wonderful, but I have to say that while Jennifer Jones was wonderful as  MADAME BOVARY, I hated the film, because I hated Madame Bovary.  I do not think I have ever despised a character in any film, and that includes, Mildred played by Bette Davis in Of Human Bondage.
So, I liked three out of the four films.  I give Jennifer Jones all the credit she deserves for her performance in that film because it shows her great range as an actress: the Song of Bernadette and Madame Bovary.

I got this at Walmart for just $9.99, these are some great movies deals 4 movies.
(Little Women / Pride and Prejudice / Madame Bovary / Anna Karenina)]]
I bought this set of Classic Films mainly to watch Little Women with June Allison.  I still haven't watched the other 3 movies.  So I rated Little Women with 5 stars.  Wonderful Christmas Classic.
I love these old movies.  This version of Little women is the best one ever. Great price also.  Recieved movies very fast.
I love classic films. Pride & Prejudice and Little Women were both AWESOME!! They are both fit for ages 5 thru 105. Enjoy!!

These old classics have endured the test of time. Reproduced in best quality. Especially the classic Little Women, which is not otherwise available, is worth the buy. Fans of Elizabeth Taylor will enjoy one of her best early performances in a slightly comic role at times.
I LIKE TO WATCH THE OLD CLASSICS AND THEN THE NEWER VERSIONS. USUALLY EQUALLY GOOD AND OFTEN IN BLACK AND WHITE.

I emailed the people who sell this DVD and specifically asked them if the Pride and Prejudice film was FINALLY the colour version which vert occasionally screens on tv.  Yes, I was assured it was the colour version.  I can say having just received the DVD - this is NOT the colour version of Pride and Prejudice finally come to DVD.  It is absolutely and definitely the black and white version that I already own.
The films are great but there is nothing new in these releases.  If you don't already own the films you will love them but don't buy them hoping for something fresh if you already have them in your collection.
One of my All-Time Favorites is "Pride and Prejudice" (This version Only). The collection wasn't great, though. "Little Women" is pretty good; but, I didn't really care at all for the other two.

Classic literature, yet easier to watch than to read, although the screen versions are the vision of those who directed and acted.  Reading lets you put yourself into the stories, but if you're a slow reader, this is a good substitute.

Pride and pregdious was the only movie i liked. The other 3 i dod not care for at all
I love old movies so if anyone likes to watch them this is a nice collection.
I bought this collection for Little Women. I love it and it was such a great price. I grew up on this Little Women and wanted it in my Christmas collection
I love classics, what can I say.
Love two of the movies. Two I didn't care for.
What a great set! Bought this for my mom for Christmas cause she had the VHS of Little Women and I felt it was time for a DVD before the other never worked again. She was very grateful and loves it!
These are all classic films of old musicals, and I love them.  I wish we had such great composers these days.
I've always loved this movie. The disc itself is fine. I haven't watched the other two DVDs.

The package arrived as scheduled. Some of the discs skip a little, but the hassle of returning items (in general) isn't worth it. Not sure how the distributor would ensure the quality of the discs prior to shipping them out. Overall, I love the movies.
